newsitem.title: USA: Computer Network investment to hurt margins.
newsitem.headline: Computer Network investment to hurt margins.

text.p: Computer Network Technology Corp said Thursday investments in open systems engineering, sales and marketing hurt profit margins in 1996 and would again in early 1997.

"We expect this high level of investment to continue to negatively affect our net profit margins until we gain additional sales momentum and our planned new products begin to penetrate the market in the first half of 1997," chief executive officer Tom Hudson said in a news release.
During 1996, the company said it increased its customer base by 16 percent for its family of software and hardware networking products.

Earlier Thursday, the company reported a net loss of $917,000, or $0.04 a share for the fourth quarter, including pre-tax charge of $2.7 million for writedown of purchased technology. That compared to a loss of $626,000, or $0.03 a share, in the year ago quarter, which included a $2.5 million charge for a management reorganization.
